page.title: 04POINTON-EMPLOYMENT
page.content: {EMPLOYMENT The main industry is farming,which is nowadays highly mechanised and run mainly by families employing little outside help. Many villagers commute to the bigger towns but there are places of employment within Pointon Village. {The old vicarage,}built 1865,was, until recently a nursery business. There is also a flourishing{mushroom {business}in a nearby manor house. {The Village Post Office:}The Post Office operates from a private home and is owned and run by a local farmer and his wife.Beside stamps they sell stationary,cards,toiletries,toys,wool and cigarettes.In 1861 the Post Office was run from the house next door.The owner left to become a tailor,it was then taken over by a cobbler,followed by his son and now the present owners.
